champ.champInfo:
The general management of the organization and conduct of competitions is carried out by the Public Organization "All-Ukrainian Association "Kyokushin BuDo Karate". The direct holding of the competition is entrusted to the Zakarpattia Regional Federation of Kyokushin BuDo Karate and the Main Board of Judges approved by the KBDK. The chief judge of the competition is national category judge Sensei Shandra Ihor Mykhailovych, 3rd Dan, Uzhgorod. The head of the panel of judges is Shikhan Leonid Semenovych Chernyavskyi, 5th Dan, Kherson. The organizers of the competition are not responsible for accidents and injuries during the competition.

The Championship of Ukraine will be held from May 26 to 28, 2023. Address of the event: Uzhhorod, str.Zankovetska, 5, SK "Yunist"

Preliminary applications for participation in the competition must be sent by May 13, 2023 (inclusive) to the address: e-mail: Tatarchenkoiu@ukr.net phone numbers for previous applications: Ihor Tatarchenko - 067 788 77 28;

Program

May 26, 2023

  • 15:00 – 19:00 mandate and medical commission, weighing of participants
  • 19:00 - 21:00 judges' seminar, formation of judges' teams

May 27, 2023

  • 07:30 – 07:45 briefing for the competition secretariat and service personnel
  • 07:45 – 08:00 meeting with team representatives
  • 08:00 - 11:00 competition in the "kata" section
  • 11:00 - 11:30 ceremonial opening of the competition, parade of participants
  • 11:30 - 14:00 start of competition in the "kumite" section
  • 14:00 - 14:30 break
  • 14:30 - 18:00 continuation of the competition in the "kumite" section
  • 18:00 - 19:00 awarding of winners and prize-winners of the competition, closing of the competition

Competition participants

Teams from regions and the city of Kyiv, which are members of the KBDC, as well as invited teams from other federations, associations, clubs, etc., are allowed to participate in the Championship of Ukraine. Age categories of competitors: boys, young men, juniors, girls, girls, juniors, men, women and veterans. Contestants must have a sports qualification of at least 8 kyu

Tournament rules

Individual-team competitions are held in the "Kumite" and "Kata" section according to the Rules of the International Kyokushin BuDo Karate Organization WKB under the Olympic system.Only the results of WKB representatives will be taken into account to determine the places of teams based on the individual-team championship, athletes from other federations compete in the individual competition outside of the individual-team competition.

Categories KUMITE men

  • 04 – 05 years: - 15 - 20 + 20
  • 06 – 07 years: - 20 - 25 + 25
  • 08 - 09 years: - 25 - 30 - 35 + 35
  • 10-11 years: - 30 - 35 - 40 + 40
  • 12-13 years: - 40 - 45 - 50 + 50
  • 14-15 years: - 50 - 55 - 60 + 60
  • 16-17 years: - 60 - 65 - 70 + 70
  • 18+ years: - 70 - 80 - 90 + 90
  • 35+ years: - 80 + 80

Categories of KUMITE women

  • 04 – 05 years: - 15 - 20 + 20
  • 06 – 07 years: - 20 - 25 + 25
  • 08 - 09 years: - 30 - 35 + 35
  • 10-11 years: - 35 - 40 + 40
  • 12-13 years: - 45 - 50 + 50
  • 14-15 years: - 50 - 55 + 55
  • 16-17 years: - 55 - 60 + 60
  • 18+ years: - 55 - 65 + 65

Conducting matches and duration of matches.

  • 04-07 years: 1.0 min.; 1.0 min.; weighing (minimum difference in weight to win 3.0 kg); 1.0 min
  • 08-11 years: 1.5 min.; 1.5 min.; weighing (minimum difference in weight to win 3.0 kg); 1.5 min
  • 12-17 years: 2.0 min.; 2.0 min.; weighing (minimum difference in weight to win 3.0 kg); 2.0 min
  • 18+ years: 3.0 min.; 2.0 min.; weighing (minimum difference in weight for victory 5.0 kg/ 3.0 kg (women)); 2.0 min

Age categories and rules of competitions in the "kata" section

  • 8 - 9
    • 1-k. Taikioku sono san
    • 2-k. Kata to choose from: Pinan sono san, Pinan sono yon
  • 10 - 11
    • 1-k. Taikioku sono san
    • 2-k. Kata to choose from: Pinan sono san, Pinan sono yon
  • 12 - 13
    • 1-k.Pinan Sono ni
    • 2-k. Kata to choose from: Pinan sono yon, Pinan sono go
  • 14 - 15
    • 1-k. Pinan sono go
    • 2-k. Kata to choose from: Gekisai dai, Tsuki no kata
  • 16 - 17
    • 1-k.Tsuki no kata
    • 2-k. Kata to choose from: Gekisai sho, Saiha
  • + 18:
    • 1-k. Gekisai Sho
    • 2-k. Kata to choose from: Garyu, Seienchin, Seipai, Kanku, Sushiho
  • 3-k for all categories: kata of the second round, which was not shown

Rewarding

  • Athletes who took 1-3 places are awarded with medals, diplomas and cups of the corresponding degrees.
  • The teams that took 1-3 places are awarded with diplomas and cups of the corresponding degrees.
